    Using a netify as a bridge to other network packages

    Ha Eun Choi, Cassy Dorff, Colin Henry, and Shahryar Minhas

    2022-12-15

    netify_bridge.Rmd
    library(devtools)
library(netify)

    Using netify as a bridge to other network packages

    netify allows us to analyze the network data with other network packages. For example, you can simply use the netlet object to use amen functions to build additive and multiplicative effects network models (AMEN models).

    For some other network packages, netfiy provides prep functions to reshape the netlet object and make it ready for analysis: - prep_for_igraph: igraph - prep_for_network: network

    All you need to do is simply providing a netlet object into these prep functions!

    For igraph:

    igraph_obj <- prep_for_igraph(event_mat)
igraph_obj
#> IGRAPH 3737fba UNW- 3205 5351 -- 
#> + attr: name (v/c), weight (e/n)
#> + edges from 3737fba (vertex names):
#> [1] 'Al Shabaab' Militia                  --Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
#> [2] 3R                                    --anti-Balaka                                                    
#> [3] Aaro Aaro                             --Al-Shabaab                                                     
#> [4] Aasi Clan Militia (Somalia)           --Abtisame Clan Militia (Somalia)                                
#> [5] Abakpa Nike Communal Militia (Nigeria)--Ezza Ethnic Militia (Nigeria)                                  
#> + ... omitted several edges

    For network:

    network_obj <- prep_for_network(event_mat)
network_obj
#>  Network attributes:
#>   vertices = 3205 
#>   directed = FALSE 
#>   hyper = FALSE 
#>   loops = FALSE 
#>   multiple = FALSE 
#>   bipartite = FALSE 
#>   total edges= 5351 
#>     missing edges= 0 
#>     non-missing edges= 5351 
#> 
#>  Vertex attribute names: 
#>     vertex.names 
#> 
#>  Edge attribute names not shown
